intro: Impatiens neomodesta, commonly known as the Chinese impatiens, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its stems are slender and often branched. Impatiens neomodesta is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
